init_tour.content01: Welcome to the FIWARE's KeyRock Identity Manager. This is a basic tour that will guide you through the basics.
init_tour.content02: Use this section to access your profile, the settings and to sign out.
init_tour.content03: You can find the different sections of KeyRock in this sidebar.
init_tour.content04: Applications are the experiments with the FIWARE technology you participate on (e.g. as an owner or purchaser). This table shows a quick summary of them.
init_tour.content05: Organizations are basically groups of users. They come in very handy when you want to authorize several users in your application at once. A quick summary of them can be found in this table.
init_tour.content06:
You finished the basics Tour! You can now head on to the next Tour and learn more about the most important settings of your profile or exit this tutorial and start experimenting yourself.

Thank you for using IdM Keyrock!

> Go to Profile Tour

profile_tour.content01: Welcome to the Profile Tour! You will now learn how the most important settings of your profile.
profile_tour.content02: Access your profile page from this menu.
profile_tour.content03: This is your profile page. It contains some useful information, such as your avatar and some personal data about yourself.
profile_tour.content04: This table shows the organizations you belong to.
profile_tour.content05: This table shows the applications you are authorized on (i.e. you were assigned at least one role on them).
profile_tour.content06: Let's include some personal information! Click this button to edit your profile.
profile_tour.content07: Provide some useful information about yourself. This will appear in your profile page.
profile_tour.content08: Choose your avatar now. You can choose from a previously uploaded image, upload a new one or even use your Gravatar!
profile_tour.content09:
You finished the Profile Tour! You can now head on to the next Tour and learn more about aplications and how to register one or exit this tutorial and start experimenting yourself.

Thank you for using IdM Keyrock!

> Go to Applications Tour

apps_tour.content01: Welcome to the Applications Tour! You will now learn how to register an application in KeyRock.
apps_tour.content02: The quickest way to register a new application is the 'Register' button. Click on it to register your first application!
apps_tour.content03:
This form contains the basic information required to create a new application.

First of all, provide a name and a longer description for your it.
apps_tour.content04: This is the URL of your app. This field is required to check that requests to KeyRock regarding your app (e.g. when using OAuth to authorize users) come actually from your app.
apps_tour.content05: This is the callback URL of your application. KeyRock will redirect the User Agent back to it after an OAuth authorization flow.
apps_tour.content06: These are the OAuth2 Grant Types that your application will allow.
apps_tour.content07: This is to select who is going be the provider of the application: yourself or one of the organizations in which you are owner.
apps_tour.content08: Click on this button to continue to the next step.
apps_tour.content09: In this step you can choose an image for your app. We will leave the default one.
apps_tour.content10: Click on this button to continue to the next step.
apps_tour.content11: In this last step, you can manage the roles and permissions of your app. We won't change anything now, but you can learn more about them in the next Tour.
apps_tour.content12: Click on this button when you're done editing your new app.
apps_tour.content13: This is the detail page of your new app, with some useful information about it.
apps_tour.content14:
You finished the Applications Tour! You can now head on to the next Tour and learn more about roles and permissions inside apps and how to manage them or exit this tutorial and start experimenting yourself.

Thank you for using IdM Keyrock!

> Go to Roles & Permissions Tour

roles_tour.content01: Welcome to the Roles & Permissions Tour! You will now learn how roles and permissions inside applications work.
roles_tour.content02:
To continue with the tour, click on any of your apps. If you don't have any, you should first create one or take the Applications tour.

> Go to Applications Tour
roles_tour.content03: Remember this is the detail page of your app. It contains some important stuff, such as the OAuth credentials, register a PEP Proxy or some IoT Sensors and manage the roles inside it.
roles_tour.content04: This link will take you to the Roles Management page or this application. Click on it to continue.
roles_tour.content05: This view lets you manage the roles and permissions of your application.
roles_tour.content06:
This is the list of roles which exist inside your application (provider and purchaser are default ones).

A role is basically a set of one or more permissions. When authorizing a user in your application, one or more roles must be assigned to them.
roles_tour.content07: Click on a role and the permissions attached to it will be shown on the right.
roles_tour.content08: This is the list of permissions which are available in your application. The checked ones are the ones attached to the role you chose.
roles_tour.content09: Use this button to create a new permission for your app.
roles_tour.content10: Use this button to create a new role for your app.
roles_tour.content11: Click on this button to save the changes you made.
roles_tour.content12: This section shows the users who have been assigned some role in your app. Use the 'Authorize' button to assign a new role to a certain user.
roles_tour.content13: This section shows the organizations who have been assigned some role in your app. Use the 'Authorize' button to assign a new role to a certain organization.
roles_tour.content14:
You finished the Roles & Permissions Tour! You can now head on to the next Tour and learn more about organizations or exit this tutorial and start experimenting yourself.

Thank you for using IdM Keyrock!

> Go to Organizations Tour

orgs_tour.content01: Welcome to the Organizations Tour! You will now learn how to create an organization in KeyRock.
orgs_tour.content02: The quickest way to create a new organization is the 'Create' button. Click on it to create your first organization!
orgs_tour.content03:
This form contains the basic information required to create a new organization.

Just provide a name and a longer description for it.
orgs_tour.content04: Click on this button when you're done to create your new organization.
orgs_tour.content05: Your new organization was successfully created. This is its home page.
orgs_tour.content06: These are the members of the organization.
orgs_tour.content07: These are the applications in which the organization is authorized.
orgs_tour.content08:
You finished the Organizations Tour! You can now head on to Help&About to learn more about KeyRock or start experimenting yourself.

Thank you for using IdM Keyrock!

> Go to Help&About

footer.author: GING DIT
footer.vish: The use of VISH services is subject to the acceptance of the
footer.fiware: The use of FIWARE Lab services is subject to acceptance of the

help_about_items.content01: If you want to learn more about this Identity Manager and how to use it, take a look at the links below:
help_about_items.item02: Complete documentation for installing, administrating and using the Identity Manager in ReadTheDocs
help_about_items.item03: Source code of the project in GitHub
help_about_items.content02: Missed one of the tours? Want to take them again? This is the complete list of tours that will guide you from the basics of this Identity Manager to some of the most advanced features.
help_about_items.tour01: Basics Tour: get to know the Welcome page.
help_about_items.tour02: Profile Tour: edit your personal data and set up an avatar.
help_about_items.tour03: Applications Tour: create your first application.
help_about_items.tour04: Roles & Permissions Tour: learn more about roles and permissions inside apps, and how to authorize other users and organizations in them.
help_about_items.tour05: Organizations Tour: create your first organization and take a look at its home page.

login.title: Sign In
login.alert02: Password changed. Please sign in again to continue.

presentation.title: Identity Manager
presentation.subtitle01: Welcome to an implementation of FIWARE Identity Manager developed by DIT-UPM.
presentation.subtitle02: You can customize this sign in page as well as any other style/layout in this web service. Check customization documentation to learn how to do it!

pass_request.title: Forgot your password?
pass_request.content: Write down the email address you associated to your account and you will receive an email with instructions about how to reset your password in a few minutes
pass_request.label: Email

pass_reset.title: Change your password
pass_reset.alert: New password and confirm password not match.

tfa.title02: In order to finish the authentication process:
tfa.content01: 1. Open the Google Authenticator app in your smartphone.
tfa.content02: 2. Introduce below the token generated by the app.
tfa.content03: 3. If it is a trusted device, check this option in order to enable Keyrock to remember it the next time you access.
tfa.content05: The verification has failed because the token introduced is not valid. Please, check that the date and hour in your device and try again.
tfa.title03: If you are not able to use the app:
tfa.content07: Click in the following button and, then, introduce your email.
tfa.content08: We will send you instructions of how to access your profile avoiding this second authentication.

change_pass.title: Change password
change_pass.content01: It's been a year since you changed the password.
change_pass.content02: To continue using this portal, please change it.

index.title: Applications
index.alert01: You are not authorized in any application.

delete_avatar.title: Delete uploaded image
delete_avatar.content01: Are you sure you want to delete this image?
delete_avatar.content02: You can upload it again whenever you want.

exit_org.title: Exit organization
exit_org.content: Are you sure you want to exit this organization?

manage_members.title: Manage your organization members
manage_members.filter_use: Use the filter (type at least two characters).
manage_members.alert02: Some users don't have any role assigned. If you save now they won't be authorized in the organization

edit.content01: Select the part of the image you want to use as avatar.
edit.content03: This will delete the organization and all its data

index.title: Organizations
index.alert01: You are not owner of any organization.
index.alert02: You are not member of any organization.

settings.title: Settings
settings.content02: We highly recommend you enable it, since it provides a higher level of security to access your account.
settings.content03: If you want to give two factor authentication a try, you need to provide a security question, just in case you happen to lose access to your authentication app.

delete_user.title: Cancel account
delete_user.content: Are you sure? Cancelling your account implies the deletion of all your resources. This action is permanent.

change_pass.title: Change Password
change_pass.pass_alert: New password and confirm password not match.

warn_change_pass.title: Change password
warn_change_pass.content: It's been a year since you changed the password. For security reasons and to continue using this portal, please change it.

enable_tfa.title: Two factor authentication
enable_tfa.content01: The verification has failed because the token introduced is not valid. Please, check that the date and hour in your device and try again.
enable_tfa.content02: If you want to enable the two factor authentication, follow these steps:
enable_tfa.content03: 1. Open the Google Authenticator app in your smartphone.
enable_tfa.content04: 2. Scan the QR code or introduce manually the key secret.
enable_tfa.content05: 3. Introduce here the token generated by the app.

disable_tfa.title: Disable two factor authentication
disable_tfa.content: Are you sure? Disabling this option will delete the stored secret key and if you want to enable again a new secret will be generated.

delete_avatar.title: Delete uploaded image
delete_avatar.content01: Are you sure you want to delete this image?
delete_avatar.content02: You can upload it again whenever you want.

edit_user.title03: Visible attributes in your profile page
edit_user.link01: We're compatible with Gravatar. Create your profile
edit_user.label05: Select the part of the image you want to use as avatar.
edit_user.warning: Note: These attributes will be included in your public information provided to applications if you consent their use.

new_user.title: Registration
new_user.alert01: The two password fields didn't match
new_user.content01: I have Gravatar and want to use it for my avatar.

show_user.alert01: You are not member or owner of any organizations.
show_user.alert02: You are not authorized in any application.

notify.title: Notify
notify.alert03: Need to write some user ids

authorize_administrators.title: Manage Administrators
authorize_administrators.alert03: Use the filter (type at least two characters).

create_user.title: Create user
create_user.alert01: The two password fields didn't match.
create_user.label07: Send an email to the user
create_user.popover_body: This will send an email to the user including the assigned password.

delete_user.title: Delete user
delete_user.content01: You are going to delete these users:
delete_user.content02: Are you sure? Deleting users implies the deletion of all their resources. This action is permanent.

reset_password.title: Change password
reset_password.alert01: The two password fields didn't match.

add_trusted_application.title: Manage trusted applications
add_trusted_application.alert03: Use the filter (type at least two characters).

authorize_organization.title: Authorize organizations in your application
authorize_organization.alert03: Use the filter (type at least two characters).
authorize_organization.alert04: Some organizations don't have any role assigned. If you save now they won't be authorized in the application
authorize_organization.popover_body: You can assign differents roles to members or owners of an organization

authorize_user.title: Authorize users in your application
authorize_user.alert03: Use the filter (type at least two characters).
authorize_user.alert04: Some users don't have any role assigned. If you save now they won't be authorized in the application

create_permission.title: Create permission
create_permission.subtitle01: HTTP Verb, Resource Rule and Authorization Service Header
create_permission.alert01: If you use the advanced rule you cannot set also action and resource.
create_permission.alert02: You need to define both action and resource or an advanced XACML Rule.
create_permission.alert03: You need to define both action and resource
create_permission.label05: Use XACML to define a more complex authorization policy.

create_usage_policy.title: Create data usage policy
create_usage_policy.label10: Here you can define the Data Usage Policy

delete_avatar.title: Delete uploaded image
delete_avatar.content01: Are you sure you want to delete this image?
delete_avatar.content02: You can upload it again whenever you want.

delete_permission.title: Delete permission
delete_permission.content01: This will permanently delete the permission from the application and can't be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

delete_role.title: Delete role
delete_role.content01: This will permanently delete the role from the application and can't be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

edit.content02: Select the part of the image you want to use as avatar.
edit.content03: This will remove the application and all its data
edit.popover01_body: For security purposes, only OAuth requests coming from this URL will be accepted by KeyRock.
edit.popover02_body: The user agent will be redirected to this URL when OAuth flow is finished.
edit.popover03_body: IdM Keyrock will redirect to this endpoint if the user agent has signed in through OAuth and it is needed to delete also de user session in Keyrock. If you don't configure this parameter, the user agent will be redirected to the endpoint specified before in url field.
edit.popover04_body: Select which grant types would accept the application in order to authorize users using Oauth 2.0 protocol. Visit Keyrock Docs for more information
edit.popover05_body: Select if you also want to allow authentication with Open ID Connect.

index.title: Applications
index.content01: You are not provider of any application.
index.content02: You are not puchaser of any application.
index.content03: You are not authorized in any application.

manage_roles.title: Manage Roles
manage_roles.content01: Select a role to see and manage its permissions
manage_roles.content02: Select a role to see and manage its policies or create a new one

new.title: Application Information
new.popover01_body: For security purposes, only OAuth requests coming from this URL will be accepted by KeyRock.
new.popover02_body: The user agent will be redirected to this URL when OAuth flow is finished.
new.popover03_body: IdM Keyrock will redirect to this endpoint if the user agent has signed in through OAuth and it is needed to delete also de user session in Keyrock. If you don't configure this parameter, the user agent will be redirected to the endpoint specified before in url field.
new.popover04_body: Select which grant types would accept the application in order to authorize users using Oauth 2.0 protocol. Visit Keyrock Docs for more information.
new.popover05_body: Select who is going be the provider of the application: yourself or one of the organizations in which you are owner.
new.popover06_body: Select if you also want to use eIDAS as authentication endpoint.
new.popover07_body: Select if you also want to allow authentication with Open ID Connect.

show.popover01_body: You will be asked for these credentials in the OAuth2 library you use for your application
show.popover02_body: You can choose to create jwt as well as permanent tokens through scope parameter of OAuth2.
show.popover03_body: A PEP Proxy, along with an Authorization PDP, will let you add authentication and authorization security to your application. This way, you will be able also to manage specific permissions and policies to your resources, allowing different access levels to your users.
show.popover04_body: If your application is related to IoT, sensors need to be registered here for them to be authenticated.
show.popover05_body: You can copy this OIC credential into your application in order to validate a JWT generated using an OIC flow.
show.content01: This application does not have any trusted application.
show.content03: This application does not have any authorized organizations.

step_create_avatar.title: Application Avatar
step_create_avatar.content01: Select the part of the image you want to use as avatar.

step_create_roles.title: Manage Roles
step_create_roles.content01: Select a role to see and manage its permissions

activate.subject: Welcome to Keyrock
activate.content02: Welcome to Keyrock! By clicking on the link 'I accept' below, you state that you have read and accepted the our Terms and Conditions and the creation of your account will be confirmed:

change_email.subject: Account email change requested
change_email.content02: You have requested to change your email account to this one. Follow the link to finish the process.

forgot_password.subject: Reset password instructions
forgot_password.content02: Someone has requested a link to change your password. You can do this through the link below.
forgot_password.content04: If you didn't request this, please ignore this email.
forgot_password.content05: Your password won't change until you access the link above and create a new one.

user_info.subject: Welcome to Keyrock
user_info.content01: Welcome to Keyrock! An account has been created on keyrock with the following credentials:

disable_2fa.subject: Two Factor Authentication - Keyrock
disable_2fa.content02: By clicking on the link below, you will disable Two Factor Authentication and you can access to your Keyrock profile

not_found.title01: the page you have requested not exist
